conclusion: Ray enters sphere from air, refractive index n₀≈1, sphere refractive index n>1.
Ray bends toward normal according to Snell’s law: n₀ sin i = n sin r.
Inside sphere, light travels straight until opposite inner surface.
At opposite point, angle θ with normal equals r by geometry in sphere.
Total internal reflection requires sin θ ≥ n₀ / n (critical-angle condition).
Since θ = r, sin r ≥ 1/n for total internal reflection.
Combine with Snell’s law: sin i = n sin r.
Sufficient condition for total internal reflection: sin i ≥ 1.
Condition sin i ≥ 1 can never be satisfied because sin i ≤ 1.
Ray inside sphere cannot satisfy total-internal-reflection requirement at opposite side.
Final conclusion: Light will always emerge from sphere; it will not undergo total reflection.
